body:
@Merovius my proposal actually takes care of this, because it never automatically sets, instead it asks for the first time and saves for later. Roll back to my proposal to see how that works.

Here again straight from my memory:

1. have a tool that looks if either $GOPATH is set or a .gopath hidden file indicates the $GOPATH
2. if only .gopath is found, set $GOPATH globally to that
2. if not, ask where to put it with a sensible default
3. if an answer is given, put .gopath there so it will automatically work the next time, and set $GOPATH
4. this tool should be run by go get etc if no gopath is set, just a simple invocation to check
